title: logging
preview: You can configure the logging level and whether the full URL is logged to the console when running Next.js in development mode. Currently, `logging` only applies to data fetching using the `fetch` API. It does not yet apply to other logs inside of Next.js. next.config.js [Code Block] Any `fetch`

title: logging
preview: By default all the incoming requests will be logged in the console during development. You can use the `incomingRequests` option to decide which requests to ignore. Since this is only logged in development, this option doesn't affect production builds. next.config.js [Code Block] Or you can disab

title: logging
content:
### [Disabling Logging](#disabling-logging)

In addition, you can disable the development logging by setting `logging` to `false`.

next.config.js

```
module.exports = {
  logging: false,
}
```

Was this helpful?

supported.
